Just being honest here. I am glad they are finally working on him, but I know it is going to take a while.

The Champion Update team has grown much larger since the Sion Rework. It's worth mentioning that Tristana/GP were technically full VGU's (New model/vo/anims/gameplay.) Although Trist/GP didn't need as much work on there core themes and gameplay as Sion/Poppy did, they were still very similar is scope/time. 

While Yorick is currently planned for sometime after the "mid-year" mage update, barring some huge catastrophe, he should be released before 2017.

I still don't understand why Trist and GP (who were perfectly fine) and other champs like Fiora and Sion, the Juggernauts...ect got their reworks ahead of Yorick. Yorick has been off of free rotation since I started playing league. I had never even saw a Yorick until I actually paid the IP to unlock him just so I could see how he worked. I would think a champion you cannot even play due to his debilitated state would be something you'd work on before the "Well, some pro's like these champs, better make em pretty for the LCS." champs.

Cause their kits were either already there or required little extra changes. Yorick needs to be reworked from the ground up and will take time. 

Think of it this way, they can either:

A) Work on Yorick for 1 year before touching the others that would take 1 month each to finish, thus taking them 1 year before we see anything from them

or 

B) Work on the champs that will only take 1 month to finish WHILE working on Yorick so we can see something new every month or 2?

Oh, c'mon! That's a very unfair comparison. For a company of Riots size, it obviously wouldn't take a whole year to finish the rework. It has to do with priorities, nothing else. They're releasing champions every few months, but for some reason the rework of Yorick would take A WHOLE YEAR? Besides, they can have multiple teams working on different champions at the same time... you're really underestimating their resources. Besides, your two points (A and B) are basically saying the same thing but for some reason point A doesn't allow the reworks of other champions... your post makes no sense.

Keep in mind that Yorick is being reworked from the ground up, that's like replacing Yorick with a brand new champion. A new champ takes anywhere from 6 months to 3 years (like Kindred or Ao Shin) to make.
God, I remember when I first started, they had a new champion every two weeks. O_o

Completely forgetting him? Now that's just disrespecting your own work.

Consider both Evelynn and Karma. These champions were taken out of rotation and stayed out for a very long time, especially Evelynn. Riot didn't "forget" about doing this, they do it for a certain reason. This reason? It's going to sound conspiratorial, but the evidence supports that they're removed so Riot can justify completely ruining some core identity to their design/character with data showing how infrequently they're played and how so many people don't even know what said champion can do. At least, this was their justification for Karma's changes.

Yorick is in a unique position with this dilemma though. Unlike Karma who was built around the concept of duality and calculated aggression (something she no longer has any relation to), Yorick's main identity was the concept of a minion summoner that didn't work because Riot doesn't have a proper interface/programming to allow true control of minions. So Yorick's "minions" ended up just being vessels for spell effects, and not much else.

What does this mean for Yorick? Well, it means that if they actually try to stick to their constant promises of "keeping the same concept" for these reworks (which usually doesn't work, or they focus on the wrong concept idea that they made up one morning), there's not really any mechanics that need to be kept. About the only thing people would really be upset about with a Yorick rework is if he completely abandons the notion of being a minion summoner, if Riot decides to turn him into a mage instead of a bruiser, or they replace his Ult with something else entirely.

Now, that doesn't change *why* Riot removed him from rotation (to skew data in their favor for drastic change), but at least in Yorick's case, it shouldn't actually hurt his identity too much. Well, at least not as badly as Karma was, at any rate.

I was always a fan of Yorick from his release, but his viability really made it hard to play him in any meta. 

I basically said "F**K it" last season and got him to rank 5 mastery and above playing him as a top laner/jungler in ranked. Won some games, lost some. 

What really drew me into him was his ultimate. Honestly, when you look at just his ultimate, not his basics, I think its one of the best ultimates in the game.  Because its on Yorick and 70% of the player base doesn't even know he exists, nobody knows what it even does. I literally have to tell my ADC "No, don't run away if you die with my ult, go fight, its not a Zilean ultimate!" Its great for splitpushing and taking towers too.

I think thematically he's great. The Gravedigger, Yorick Mori. Busts his ass on the Shadow Isles doing the dirty work. An every man. He definitely needs his background _fleshed_ out a little more, but I hope he doesn't change much. His voice acting is also some of the best in the game, in my opinion. Its a shame he doesn't have more lines. Go listen to it (because you've probably never heard it before), tell me it doesn't sound awesome. It fits him perfectly.

His problem really lies in his basic abilities. They lack oomph. There's no real skill or thought involved in using them other than blocking skillshots with his W, that's the best. Blocking a blitzgrab or Ahri charm with his ghoul is badass. His passive makes him more of a juggernaut in my opinion, and I hope that's where Riot takes his rework. 

I have faith though, I know Riot will treat Mr. Mori right.  {{champion:83}}
